summary: Territories.tsx adds logic to derive a publisher display value using the most recent checkout record and fetches publishers via useGetAllPublishers, but the diff snippet does not show the actual table header/cell insertion or muted styling, so key UI placement/styling requirements cannot be verified.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update the Territories table to include a new "Publisher" column positioned between "Territory Number" and "Status" (header and row cells), keeping all other behaviors unchanged.
missing_requirements.reason: The provided diff excerpt for Territories.tsx is truncated before the table JSX, so there is no visible evidence that a "Publisher" <TableHead> and corresponding <TableCell> were added or that column order was adjusted.

missing_requirements.requirement: When status is "Available", display exactly "—" in a muted/gray text style (e.g., text-muted-foreground) in the Publisher cell; fail gracefully with muted "—" if checked out but no record is found.
missing_requirements.reason: The logic returns "—" for Available and missing-record cases, but the diff excerpt does not show any JSX/styling applying a muted/gray class to the rendered em dash in the table cell.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced an additional helper to compute an "active" checkout record (most recent record with dateReturned null/undefined), which may affect duration calculation behavior.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest only asks to add a Publisher column derived from the most recent checkout record; adding/altering logic around the active checkout record is not requested and could potentially change existing page behavior.

hallucinated_features.description: Publisher display logic explicitly returns an em dash for statuses other than "Available" and "Checked Out" (e.g., "Under Review").
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest specifies behavior for "Checked Out" and "Available" only; handling other statuses this way is additional behavior not explicitly requested (though it may be acceptable).
evidence: frontend/src/pages/Territories.tsx (truncated) - getPublisherName returns '—' for other statuses
